revised_title: Histological and Physiological Study of Pepsin-Forming Glands
tldr: The author examines the structure and function of various pepsin-forming glands in the gastrointestinal tract, including the oesophageal, oxyntic, pyloric, and intermediate zone glands. They discuss the changes that occur during digestion and the role of pepsin in the process. The study provides insights into the functioning of the stomach and the role of different gland types in digestion.
